commit_message:
WIP: Emulate v2 behavior for "create a private flavor" API

This patch adds v2 behavior of "create a private flavor" API on v3 API
method.

This way is a little durty due to adding v2 code into v3 method, but
the difference is small and the separation method seems overkill.

Partially implements blueprint v2-on-v3-api

Change-Id: Id05af80c111dda5d777fe3634110f5cdc95e3c0e

commit_message:
Fix wrong fake return values for Nova V3 client tests

The response format for the hypervisor servers list action in
Nova API V3 has changed. This patch corrects the fake return
values used for client testing.

Change-Id: I645607b5adcfe3fa1c1d1efc071c87d2bb2b37b5
Closes-Bug: #1309542

commit_message:
Add go_to_home_page method and two more properties

I added the brand property which is used by the go_to_home_page
method. This method will generally be used for tests.
In particular, it will be part of the TestCase class, which is planned
to be the base class for all tests (on top of helpers's BaseTestCase
class), except login tests.

In addition, I modified the css selector in the _user_indicator_locator
and made the user property from it.

https://wiki.openstack.org/wiki/Horizon/Testing/UI

Partially implements blueprint: selenium-integration-testing

Change-Id: Ic614c6a37ea04aeccf1a06312f4bcd20e5fe2c76

commit_message:
Add agent fields to virt driver

This change adds required fields for the agent driver to the
Ironic virt driver. It also makes the add/remove fields code a bit
more generic for use by multiple drivers.

commit_message:
Add last_modified & created_on attributes to jobs

In order to be able to allow jobboard object users
to know when a job was last modified or when the
job was created we need to provide accessors to make
this possible. These can be used to claim a job after
a given period, or for general tracking of which are
the oldest jobs...

Implements: blueprint job-reference-impl

Change-Id: I467bb083d0b143826a44c6aeb6499c483b88fe65

subject: Allow jobboard event notification
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-04-22 01:40:21.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/engines/base.py', 'doc/source/notifications.rst', 'taskflow/jobs/jobboard.py', 'taskflow/jobs/backends/impl_zookeeper.py', 'taskflow/listeners/logging.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_utils.py', 'taskflow/listeners/base.py', 'taskflow/listeners/printing.py', 'taskflow/utils/misc.py'], 'message': "Allow jobboard event notification

Instead of requiring iteration to be able to list new
jobs and existing jobs so that they can be claimed, allow
for attaching callbacks to the jobboard where instead of
requiring iteration those callbacks will be automatically
called by the jobboard internally when events are recieved.

Breaking change: renames transition notifier to notifier
since it is really not just a notifier for transitions but
is a generic notifier of events occuring (and details about
those events). This is an internal api so its not expected
that this will cause any issues (it's not expected for external
users to be creating instances of this class).

Implements bp board-notification

Change-Id: I2384d5e335ed9d17e29fec9a78699e3156fa225c
"}]
commit_message:
Allow jobboard event notification

Instead of requiring iteration to be able to list new
jobs and existing jobs so that they can be claimed, allow
for attaching callbacks to the jobboard where instead of
requiring iteration those callbacks will be automatically
called by the jobboard internally when events are recieved.

Breaking change: renames transition notifier to notifier
since it is really not just a notifier for transitions but
is a generic notifier of events occuring (and details about
those events). This is an internal api so its not expected
that this will cause any issues (it's not expected for external
users to be creating instances of this class).

Implements bp board-notification

Change-Id: I2384d5e335ed9d17e29fec9a78699e3156fa225c

subject: Use sequencing when posting jobs
revisions:
[{'number': 7, 'created': '2014-04-22 01:38:55.000000000', 'files': ['test-requirements.txt', 'taskflow/jobs/jobboard.py', 'taskflow/jobs/backends/impl_zookeeper.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/jobs/test_zk_job.py'], 'message': 'Use sequencing when posting jobs

Retain the posting order by using sequencing when posting
jobs to a jobboard (at least in the impl_zookeeper case
this is possible).

Adjust the interface to recommend that jobboard implementations
post in oldest to newest order (we can not easily enforce this
since some implementations will likely not be able to do this
in every scenario).

Bring in a new zake which has sequencing support (since this
is required to support this feature).

Change-Id: I0c475c3c1d16e9bbc9db6ff0ad6b7103c5948a47
'}]
commit_message:
Use sequencing when posting jobs

Retain the posting order by using sequencing when posting
jobs to a jobboard (at least in the impl_zookeeper case
this is possible).

Adjust the interface to recommend that jobboard implementations
post in oldest to newest order (we can not easily enforce this
since some implementations will likely not be able to do this
in every scenario).

Bring in a new zake which has sequencing support (since this
is required to support this feature).

Change-Id: I0c475c3c1d16e9bbc9db6ff0ad6b7103c5948a47

subject: Fix convert params and result in AdHocAction
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-04-18 10:25:11.000000000', 'files': ['mistral/tests/unit/engine/test_data_flow_module.py', 'mistral/tests/unit/test_expressions.py', 'mistral/engine/data_flow.py', 'mistral/actions/std_actions.py', 'mistral/expressions.py'], 'message': 'Fix convert params and result in AdHocAction

 * Fixed wrong convertation of action params and result.
   In action parameters we can have an arbitrary dict, so
   this dict can contain lists, or other dicts. To convert
   params we should apply converter dict to base spec params
   and action result accordingly.

Change-Id: I7549931c69637dfdf2bfa6583b8a78f8589b40b4
'}]
commit_message:
Fix convert params and result in AdHocAction

 * Fixed wrong convertation of action params and result.
   In action parameters we can have an arbitrary dict, so
   this dict can contain lists, or other dicts. To convert
   params we should apply converter dict to base spec params
   and action result accordingly.

Change-Id: I7549931c69637dfdf2bfa6583b8a78f8589b40b4

subject: Version agent lookup payloads
revisions:
[{'number': 8, 'created': '2014-04-13 00:52:28.000000000', 'files': ['ironic/drivers/modules/agent.py', 'ironic/tests/drivers/test_agent.py'], 'message': "Version agent lookup payloads

Begin versioning agent 'lookup' payloads. This doesn't actually
introduce support for any versioned payloads, but rather treats
unversioned payloads as 'v0' and adds some code to make it easier to
add version specific handlers.

Change-Id: I064ee8ec9d12e11601f63d274becbe348a032b1c
"}]
commit_message:
Version agent lookup payloads

Begin versioning agent 'lookup' payloads. This doesn't actually
introduce support for any versioned payloads, but rather treats
unversioned payloads as 'v0' and adds some code to make it easier to
add version specific handlers.

Change-Id: I064ee8ec9d12e11601f63d274becbe348a032b1c

commit_message:
Fix the unlimited length of console-log

Since the commit Idf88a238d1b0e545ebab5be872269b1b1030cc56 of Nova,
the unlimited length has been changed to -1 for API consistency.

This patch applies it to novaclient.

Change-Id: I581609a55f081184ad9d791ba38d78fa30d298a6
Closes-Bug: #1295426

commit_message:
Update Launch Instance button with ajax

Launch Instance button updates after instance has been terminated:
- added html temlpate for table actions
- ajax-update and update-url classes were added for link actions
- update all required actions via ajax when rows were removed from the table

Closes-Bug: #1192621
Change-Id: I81e8ea4e1921bbf344d210ba3353d51d4c11a7d1

commit_message:
gw_port should be set as lazy='join'

This forces the object to be ready ahead of accessing time.
The change in loading behavior is also beneficial while listing
routers, as reduces the amount of queries being issued. Tests
show a performance gain of 15-30% for router-list times.

As Mr. Aaron Rosen is used to saying: Woot woot!!

Closes-bug: #1309144

Change-Id: Ibae261b91de26ca7c50e3f6c80e9be2a799785a3

commit_message:
ML2 Cisco Nexus MD: Improve Unit Test Coverage

Improve unit test coverage for:
neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/cisco/ modules.

Current coverage info:
neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/cisco/nexus/nexus_models_v2      65%
neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/cisco/nexus/nexus_network_driver 82%
neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/cisco/nexus/credentials_v2       81%
neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/cisco/nexus/mech_cisco_nexus     78%
neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/cisco/nexus/config               75%

With these updates:
neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/cisco/nexus/mech_cisco_nexus     99%
neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/cisco/nexus/nexus_db_v2          99%
neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/cisco/nexus/nexus_models_v2      65%
neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/cisco/nexus/nexus_network_driver 98%
neutron/plugins/ml2/drivers/cisco/nexus/config               100%

NB: nexus_models_v2.py consists of database definitions and two
customization methods, __repr__ and __eq__.

Change-Id: I0de1cb9e71adffff698e37c8bec5497b88f0f0cd
Closes-Bug: 1267481

commit_message:
Document that nova-network and VDS port group must be ephemeral

Add content clarifying that the port binding for the br100 port
group must be configured as ephemeral in vCenter. Included link
to a KB article that discusses port bindings.

[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-03-27 23:54:29.000000000', 'files': ['nova/api/openstack/compute/contrib/server_groups.py'], 'message': 'Fix display of server group members

The previous code was failing to display the members of server

commit_message:
Fix display of server group members

The previous code was failing to display the members of server
groups because it was filtering them all out.

Interestingly, the previous code passes the unit tests due to a
bug where we treat regex comparisons differently when using mysql
vs sqlite (tracked under bug 1298690).

Change-Id: I7be9c180f4284dd18cd02e510e77e3c1e3fc9925
Closes-bug: 1298494

commit_message:
Use one query instead of two for quota_usages

The second query was unnecessary and not using a proper index. It
seemed to be contributing to a deadlock issue as well.

Change-Id: I1031451b25140d71380c8149d3c83827eec0d4a9
Closes-Bug: #1308715
Co-Authored-by: Chris Behrens <cbehrens@codestud.com>

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-17 21:51:11.000000000', 'files': ['test-functions.sh'], 'message': "usability improvements to test-functions.sh

instead of dying at the first error found, run all the tests
and show all the errors. This makes it simpler to debug as you
can address more than one issue at once.

add the use of the bash 'caller' function to automatically print
out the name of the function and line number on both successful
and failing asserts. This ensures it's easy to get to the issue
at hand.

Change-Id: If15f50c6c41aa3940682d41c776589407a42bf4f
"}]
commit_message:
usability improvements to test-functions.sh

instead of dying at the first error found, run all the tests
and show all the errors. This makes it simpler to debug as you
can address more than one issue at once.

add the use of the bash 'caller' function to automatically print
out the name of the function and line number on both successful
and failing asserts. This ensures it's easy to get to the issue
at hand.

Change-Id: If15f50c6c41aa3940682d41c776589407a42bf4f

subject: Set *_DEVSTACK_BRANCH in grenade's localrc
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-21 20:20:54.000000000', 'files': ['devstack-vm-gate.sh'], 'message': "Set *_DEVSTACK_BRANCH in grenade's localrc

In If9417e65c7c54d017c4c847a4020f855684c423c we are using
BASE_DEVSTACK_BRANCH to specify the upgrade_level.compute value for
nova. So we need devstack-gate to overwrite the default value with the
branch d-g is preparing. This patch will allow
If9417e65c7c54d017c4c847a4020f855684c423c to work on stable/havana and
stable/icehouse, so we can land that patch and then change grenade to
icehouse in a self-gating manor.

Set TARGET_DEVSTACK_BRANCH for symmetries sake.

Change-Id: I22093166e7f100958baeabf7549de5c82ce518b2
"}]
commit_message:
Set *_DEVSTACK_BRANCH in grenade's localrc

In If9417e65c7c54d017c4c847a4020f855684c423c we are using
BASE_DEVSTACK_BRANCH to specify the upgrade_level.compute value for
nova. So we need devstack-gate to overwrite the default value with the
branch d-g is preparing. This patch will allow
If9417e65c7c54d017c4c847a4020f855684c423c to work on stable/havana and
stable/icehouse, so we can land that patch and then change grenade to
icehouse in a self-gating manor.

Set TARGET_DEVSTACK_BRANCH for symmetries sake.

Change-Id: I22093166e7f100958baeabf7549de5c82ce518b2

commit_message:
Add nova_ca_certificates_file option to neutron

Previously, neutron had no way to pass a certificates file to the
novaclient.  This change is to add that ability, similar to the way
you can pass a certificates file to neutronclient in nova.conf via
neturon_ca_certificates_file.

Change-Id: I1a3f85505eb44bee604900301af79d773e1952a3
Closes-Bug: #1309694

commit_message:
Bump minimum requirement for dogpile.cache

Move the minimum requirement for dogpile.cache to 0.5.3 for py3k
compatibility fix (on .get_multi() ) and general quality of life
fixes for interacting with the region objects (.is_configured
instead of a try/except or if 'backend' in __dict__).

Change-Id: I21cff58726997f5c6564e9b66520c9c51802fe3b

subject: Allow transient values to be stored in storage
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-11 21:55:33.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/storage.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/test_storage.py'], 'message': 'Allow transient values to be stored in storage

Instead of requiring all values to be saved to storage
in a persistent manner allow certain values to be saved
in memory only (aka transient values) so that tasks can
accept things which should not be persisted (resources,
passwords, file handles, sockets...)

Breaking change: disallowing empty names for atom details
when they are ensured for (previously this was not done
at the storage level) but at the execution level. This
adds it in both places.

Change-Id: Ie68abdcf94f33fba5dbc05f03397aea5d82ea88f
'}]
commit_message:
Allow transient values to be stored in storage

Instead of requiring all values to be saved to storage
in a persistent manner allow certain values to be saved
in memory only (aka transient values) so that tasks can
accept things which should not be persisted (resources,
passwords, file handles, sockets...)

Breaking change: disallowing empty names for atom details
when they are ensured for (previously this was not done
at the storage level) but at the execution level. This
adds it in both places.

Change-Id: Ie68abdcf94f33fba5dbc05f03397aea5d82ea88f

commit_message:
Use known protocol scheme in keystone tests

With the recent introduction of the identity_uri in keystoneclient,
there is a small backward incompatible change which means that weird
protocols like the ones we use during tests aren't support properly
anymore. The patch replaces "foottp" and "barttp" by "file" hopefully
keeping testing coverage the same.

Change-Id: Idb30ff3ee0ca50911e453899ad32e630f9b18724
Closes-Bug: #1309092
(cherry picked from commit e5b7606eaa94033256eb1aca5f6a6eed4f9e54a0)
(cherry picked from commit a1ec218d683e27434a5b085f1fbc7e3c13b60684)

[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-03-10 14:16:41.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/compute/test_resource_tracker.py'], 'message': 'Make test computations explicit

This test is full of magic numbers, making it very difficult to fix when
the underlying code changes. There are some obvious errors, such as an
instance having a different memory_mb value than its flavor. This patch
attempts to sort these issues out, making it easier to work on the
resource tracker with confidence.

Change-Id: I4549f0d9b10a5ac65f169199b98b8975ef2a8cd3
'}]
commit_message:
Make test computations explicit

This test is full of magic numbers, making it very difficult to fix when
the underlying code changes. There are some obvious errors, such as an
instance having a different memory_mb value than its flavor. This patch
attempts to sort these issues out, making it easier to work on the
resource tracker with confidence.

Change-Id: I4549f0d9b10a5ac65f169199b98b8975ef2a8cd3

commit_message:
Add support for https requests on nova metadata

Adds new config value for accessing nova metadata api with SSL. In case
nova api requires client certificate other config values were added
providing client certificate and client private key.

DocImpact

Closes-bug: #1293587
Change-Id: I782a12eb77553f4369b782071b4ad19efb82e5e2

subject: Be better at failure tolerance
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-04-19 18:28:58.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/engines/action_engine/graph_action.py'], 'message': "Be better at failure tolerance

Instead of raising exceptions from a graph action
while tasks are still running or if a set of tasks
was scheduled and the last task could not be
scheduled (for example) just add the failure to the
failure list and continue processing what is actively
running.

This ensures that we don't leave futures in an
abandoned state and clean up our executing work which
is what all good behaving software should try to do.

Change-Id: I9256d7afa86f922273586a98b27442b6ba87767c
"}]
commit_message:
Be better at failure tolerance

Instead of raising exceptions from a graph action
while tasks are still running or if a set of tasks
was scheduled and the last task could not be
scheduled (for example) just add the failure to the
failure list and continue processing what is actively
running.

This ensures that we don't leave futures in an
abandoned state and clean up our executing work which
is what all good behaving software should try to do.

Change-Id: I9256d7afa86f922273586a98b27442b6ba87767c

revisions:
[{'number': 5, 'created': '2014-04-07 23:35:26.000000000', 'files': ['taskflow/jobs/jobboard.py', 'taskflow/jobs/backends/impl_zookeeper.py', 'taskflow/tests/unit/jobs/test_zk_job.py'], 'message': "Allow for only iterating over the most 'fresh' jobs

Instead of allowing the backend to determine how fresh
are the jobs yielded back (in the zookeeper case the jobs
are async populated so freshness depends on the freshness of

Change-Id: I8a7c9d7d086ad5fa85dc842fb36e3356f781f057

commit_message:
Allow for only iterating over the most 'fresh' jobs

Instead of allowing the backend to determine how fresh
are the jobs yielded back (in the zookeeper case the jobs
are async populated so freshness depends on the freshness of
the watches established) allow the iteration method to support
a way to request (if backend supported) that the jobs iterated
be as fresh as possible.

Change-Id: I8a7c9d7d086ad5fa85dc842fb36e3356f781f057

Doing this allows for functionality that isn't exposed

It also makes it possible (if ever needed) to replace

Change-Id: I0a825d5637236d7b5dbdbda0d426adb0183d5ba3

commit_message:
Add a directed graph type (new types module)

Most of the utility graph functions we have can
be connected to a directed graph class that itself
derives (and adds on to) the networkx base class.

Doing this allows for functionality that isn't exposed
in networkx to be exposed in our subclass (which is a
useful pattern to have).

It also makes it possible (if ever needed) to replace
the networkx usage in taskflow with something else if
this ever becomes a major request.

Change-Id: I0a825d5637236d7b5dbdbda0d426adb0183d5ba3

commit_message:
Fix the incorrect return messages in keypair show and delete

When we delete or show a keypair, if the keypair doesn't exist,
we'll get "The resource could not be found.(HTTP 404)", this
patch will change it to "ERROR: No keypair with a name or ID of
'keypair_name' exists."

Change-Id: Ifebd8d2213c327f3d3fdd672207170aebbe1bb40
Closes-Bug: #1307338

commit_message:
Fix bug detach volume fails with "KeyError" in EC2

Modified volume['instance_uuid'] to volume.get('instance_uuid'),
to avoid "KeyError", when detach a volume with "attaching" status.

Change-Id: Ic1aacab212c2a2026d18ef57ad9d77fdc6d86b47
Closes-Bug: #1280532
(cherry picked from commit fa72e49845179e29cf918e0742ef735ae868bb4c)

subject: Don't overwrite instance object with dict in _init_instance()
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-18 21:31:22.000000000', 'files': ['nova/tests/compute/test_compute_mgr.py', 'nova/compute/manager.py'], 'message': "Don't overwrite instance object with dict in _init_instance()

If a compute service is started while it has an instance in task_state
REBOOT_STARTED or REBOOT_STARTED_HARD it will trigger an instance update
which will overwrite the instance object with an instance dict.  This
causes an AttributeError on the next line when instance.task_state is
referenced.  This seems like a simple oversight and should be switched
to using the instance.save method.

Change-Id: I44c3eab2c8821b66b0b9ef4696e56bd577ae8fed
Closes-Bug: 1309067
(cherry picked from commit b4b5254a56d808f2582784897364de1adafeb43a)
"}]
commit_message:
Don't overwrite instance object with dict in _init_instance()

If a compute service is started while it has an instance in task_state
REBOOT_STARTED or REBOOT_STARTED_HARD it will trigger an instance update
which will overwrite the instance object with an instance dict.  This
causes an AttributeError on the next line when instance.task_state is
referenced.  This seems like a simple oversight and should be switched
to using the instance.save method.

Change-Id: I44c3eab2c8821b66b0b9ef4696e56bd577ae8fed
Closes-Bug: 1309067
(cherry picked from commit b4b5254a56d808f2582784897364de1adafeb43a)

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-15 07:29:42.000000000', 'files': ['glance/tests/unit/common/test_wsgi.py', 'glance/store/__init__.py', 'glance/tests/unit/common/test_property_utils.py', 'glance/tests/unit/utils.py', 'glance/tests/unit/v1/test_api.py', 'glance/tests/unit/test_auth.py', 'glance/tests/unit/test_swift_store.py', 'glance/store/base.py', 'glance/tests/utils.py'], 'message': "Uses None instead of mutables for function param defaults

Addressing bug 1307878, changes use of mutable lists and dicts as
default arguments and defaults them within the function. Otherwise,
those defaults can be unexpectedly persisted with the function between
invocations and erupt into mass hysteria on the streets.

To my knowledge there aren't known cases of the current use causing
specific issues, but needs addressing (even stylistically) to avoid
problems in the future -- ones that may crop up as extremely subtle or
intermittent bugs...or worse, security vulnerabilities.

In Glance's case there are ACL-related methods using this, so
although I haven't confirmed one way or the other yet, I've marked it
with SecurityImpact so that a more knowledgeable set of eyes can
review it in this context as well.

Closes-Bug: #1307878
SecurityImpact

Change-Id: Ic17c330eff701ff63701c0029b26db7093a1d73d
"}]
commit_message:
Uses None instead of mutables for function param defaults

Addressing bug 1307878, changes use of mutable lists and dicts as
default arguments and defaults them within the function. Otherwise,
those defaults can be unexpectedly persisted with the function between
invocations and erupt into mass hysteria on the streets.

To my knowledge there aren't known cases of the current use causing
specific issues, but needs addressing (even stylistically) to avoid
problems in the future -- ones that may crop up as extremely subtle or
intermittent bugs...or worse, security vulnerabilities.

In Glance's case there are ACL-related methods using this, so
although I haven't confirmed one way or the other yet, I've marked it
with SecurityImpact so that a more knowledgeable set of eyes can
review it in this context as well.

Closes-Bug: #1307878
SecurityImpact

Change-Id: Ic17c330eff701ff63701c0029b26db7093a1d73d

commit_message:
Clean up redstack to use SERVICE_HOST

- Cleaned up redstack to use SERVICE_HOST in places where it was
  using localhost, or a hardcoded IP

- Cleaned up client wrappers to OS services which were also using
  hardcoded paths in their connection URLs

Closes-bug: 1278652
Change-Id: I2a284a476dc325c704d2517616b723ac964420d3

commit_message:
Allow DesiredCapacity to be zero

When updating or validating a AutoScaleGroup,
'DesiredCapacity' is ignored if the value is 0.

- Add validation for 'DesiredCapacity' if the value is 0,
- Don't ignore zero when updating.

Change-Id: I830aaf97ebed6b2c77c72b18dc8d222ce23f9a28
Partial-Bug: #1304423

commit_message:
Update 'Member' with option 'operator_role' in tempest.conf

In function _get_object_storage_client(), it is better to use the
option 'operator_role' in tempest.conf than hard code the role
to 'Member' here.

Change-Id: Id1de7ee55159f6583a0a93ee87e26a5deaacfd6e
Closes-Bug: #1267857
(cherry picked from commit 5384ef569b36abaa8078f4114ec0187d9280f47b)

commit_message:
Ensure info cache updates don't overwhelm cells

Cells does its own healing of the info cache outside
of get_instance_nw_info, so we have double healing
happening if info_cache_cells_update is called for every
get_instance_nw_info. This also overwhelms cells'
ability to keep the global db updated at scale. Similar
functionality exists in nova/network/api.py.

Change-Id: I58f681f3674d826e3dce4fa956e2eb0e4c60f82b

revisions:
[{'number': 9, 'created': '2014-04-18 21:21:14.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/midonet/plugin.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/test_l3_plugin.py', 'neutron/plugins/vmware/plugins/base.py', 'neutron/db/l3_db.py', 'neutron/plugins/vmware/plugins/service.py'], 'message': 'allow delete_port to work when there are multiple floating ips

It is possible to associate multiple floating ip addresses with a single
port through the use of multiple *fixed* ip addresses, e.g.:

    nova boot ... --nic net-id=my-net-id myserver
    nova add-fixed-ip myserver my-net-id
    nova add-floating-ip --fixed-address x.x.x.1 myserver y.y.y.y.1
    nova add-floating-ip --fixed-address x.x.x.2 myserver y.y.y.y.2

In this situation, neutron.db.l3_db.disassociate_floatingips would throw
an exception:

    Exception: Multiple floating IPs found for port <port-id>

This would prevent someone from deleting an instance that was associated
with multiple floating ips.

This patch corrects disassociate_floatingips so that it will
disassociate all floating ips associated with the port, allowing the
delete operation to proceed correctly.

Change-Id: I68a2131fa8ee80828354c9db4ac405c3f77c3b90
Closes-bug: 1302701
'}]
commit_message:
allow delete_port to work when there are multiple floating ips

It is possible to associate multiple floating ip addresses with a single
port through the use of multiple *fixed* ip addresses, e.g.:

    nova boot ... --nic net-id=my-net-id myserver
    nova add-fixed-ip myserver my-net-id
    nova add-floating-ip --fixed-address x.x.x.1 myserver y.y.y.y.1
    nova add-floating-ip --fixed-address x.x.x.2 myserver y.y.y.y.2

In this situation, neutron.db.l3_db.disassociate_floatingips would throw
an exception:

    Exception: Multiple floating IPs found for port <port-id>

This would prevent someone from deleting an instance that was associated
with multiple floating ips.

This patch corrects disassociate_floatingips so that it will
disassociate all floating ips associated with the port, allowing the
delete operation to proceed correctly.

Change-Id: I68a2131fa8ee80828354c9db4ac405c3f77c3b90
Closes-bug: 1302701

commit_message:
NSX: ensure dhcp port is setup on metadata network

Change in scheduling behavior caused a regression
where the dhcp port is no longer provisioned on
the (admin) metadata network created when a subnet
is uplinked to a router.

This change recovers the past behavior and extend UT
coverage to avoid further regression.

Closes-bug: #1304127

Change-Id: I8420203f68a43368f3784adb0c4cbbe55f048662
(cherry picked from commit 4cb3eb2a98246f28f8016cfe32946d365203fbae)

commit_message:
netaddr<=0.7.10 raises ValueError instead of AddrFormatError

This patch ensures that ValueError is also caught in addition to
AddrFormatError as in netaddr>=0.7.11 AddrFormatError is raised and
in netaddr<=0.7.10 ValueError is raised.

Change-Id: I595c90e42129a2d365f3860e3042e826bd031365
Closes-bug: #1308675
(cherry picked from commit dd2ccd12adfb6c7d4aa500ba4120f767beeed35c)

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-04-18 20:25:58.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/tests/unit/test_extension_security_group.py', 'neutron/db/securitygroups_db.py', 'neutron/extensions/securitygroup.py', 'neutron/common/exceptions.py'], 'message': 'Validate CIDR given as ip-prefix in security-group-rule-create

There was no validation for the provided ip prefix. This just adds
a simple parse using netaddr and explodes with appropriate message.
Also makes sure ip prefix _is_ cidr (192.168.1.1-->192.168.1.1/32).

Validation occurs at the attribute level (API model) as well as at
the db level, where the ethertype is validated against the ip_prefix
address type.

Unit test cases added - bad prefix, unmasked prefix and incorrect
ethertype. Also adds attribute test cases for the added
convert_ip_prefix_to_cidr method

Closes-Bug: 1255338

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/unit/test_security_groups_rpc.py

Change-Id: I71fb8c887963a122a5bd8cfdda800026c1cd3954
(cherry picked from commit 65aa92b0348b7ab8413f359b00825610cdf66607)
'}]
commit_message:
Validate CIDR given as ip-prefix in security-group-rule-create

There was no validation for the provided ip prefix. This just adds
a simple parse using netaddr and explodes with appropriate message.
Also makes sure ip prefix _is_ cidr (192.168.1.1-->192.168.1.1/32).

Validation occurs at the attribute level (API model) as well as at
the db level, where the ethertype is validated against the ip_prefix
address type.

Unit test cases added - bad prefix, unmasked prefix and incorrect
ethertype. Also adds attribute test cases for the added
convert_ip_prefix_to_cidr method

Closes-Bug: 1255338

Conflicts:
	neutron/tests/unit/test_security_groups_rpc.py

Change-Id: I71fb8c887963a122a5bd8cfdda800026c1cd3954
(cherry picked from commit 65aa92b0348b7ab8413f359b00825610cdf66607)

commit_message:
Fix wrongly printed count of received handled conditions.

The WaitConditionTimeout message was using size of the reason
string as input instead of the actual number of status reasons.

Change-Id: I9ad1813755eda6924ffeff116eaeda9f36b601d1
Closes-Bug: #1297230

commit_message:
Rewrite rabbit init scripts

This scripts are takes from packages and retry loops
are added. When booted nodes will wait for the primary
node goes up and then will connect to the cluster.

Closes-bug: 1308455
Change-Id: I6748577e71c0e2be10a9298b9691c335e5be45c5

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-17 21:56:49.000000000', 'files': ['neutron/plugins/vmware/common/sync.py', 'neutron/tests/unit/vmware/test_nsx_sync.py'], 'message': 'NSX: sync thread catches wrong exceptions on not found

Previously the sync code expected exc.NoResultFound to be raised if a
port/router/network was not found in the database. This is actually not the
correct exception raised. This error will only occur if an element is deleted
from the db right when the sync thead is run for a specific element.

Change-Id: I3a5c8316ade49004fb9fa0b454435205c543f6ee
Closes-bug: 1309208
'}]
commit_message:
NSX: sync thread catches wrong exceptions on not found

Previously the sync code expected exc.NoResultFound to be raised if a
port/router/network was not found in the database. This is actually not the
correct exception raised. This error will only occur if an element is deleted
from the db right when the sync thead is run for a specific element.

Change-Id: I3a5c8316ade49004fb9fa0b454435205c543f6ee
Closes-bug: 1309208

This makes the metadata server use instance.info_cache for getting

(and thus, the database) for it. It also converts the network-api

commit_message:
Remove metadata's network-api dependence on the database

This makes the metadata server use instance.info_cache for getting
an instance's info cache instead of going direct to the network-api
(and thus, the database) for it. It also converts the network-api
implementation of get_fixed_ip_by_address() to use and return an
object. Since that translates to the same DB call in the end, none
of the network tests need to change.

Change-Id: Iab444b1669628604f7d96d9550eb684645c554cb
Closes-bug: #1306009

[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-04-08 19:39:17.000000000', 'files': ['barbican/tests/crypto/test_extension_manager.py', 'barbican/crypto/p11_crypto.py', 'barbican/crypto/plugin.py', 'barbican/crypto/extension_manager.py', 'barbican/tests/crypto/test_plugin.py', 'barbican/tests/crypto/test_p11_crypto.py'], 'message': 'Update crypto plugin interface to support Dogtag

The Crypto plugin interface needs to be modified to support
a Dogtag DRM plugin.  Specifically, we will replace the create()
method with a new generate() method that returns the same values
as encrypt().

The plugin interface is also modified to pass data to the decrypt(),
encrypt() and generate() calls using DTO objects.  This will allow
the interface to more easily extended to pass more data in future.

For instance, it will later be necessary to pass a wrapping key for
encrypt() and decrypt() operations in case we want the secret to be
completely encrypted from end to end.

We have chosen not to create the secret in the database earlier to
generate a UUID for the DRM to use as a client key ID.  Rather, a
random value will be generated by the dogtag DRM plugin.

Change-Id: I508321697c8a4557d1e35cd5a9e8f0affd992cd5
'}]
commit_message:
Update crypto plugin interface to support Dogtag

The Crypto plugin interface needs to be modified to support
a Dogtag DRM plugin.  Specifically, we will replace the create()
method with a new generate() method that returns the same values
as encrypt().

The plugin interface is also modified to pass data to the decrypt(),
encrypt() and generate() calls using DTO objects.  This will allow
the interface to more easily extended to pass more data in future.

For instance, it will later be necessary to pass a wrapping key for
encrypt() and decrypt() operations in case we want the secret to be
completely encrypted from end to end.

We have chosen not to create the secret in the database earlier to
generate a UUID for the DRM to use as a client key ID.  Rather, a
random value will be generated by the dogtag DRM plugin.

Implements: blueprint update-crypto-plugin-interface
Change-Id: I508321697c8a4557d1e35cd5a9e8f0affd992cd5

subject: Update glance notification config on Icehouse
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-16 11:39:23.000000000', 'files': ['templates/default/glance-api.conf.erb', 'spec/api_spec.rb'], 'message': "Update glance notification config on Icehouse

Red Hat bug https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1087499
clarifies how we should be configuring notifications when not using the
legacy notifier_strategy configuration option.  This new configuration
isn't well documented so it was not clear from the get-go how to
proceed.  In summary:

- notifier_strategy should still be present but set to 'default' (this
  is extra important on Red Hat as they set this configuration to
  'qpid' in /usr/share/glance/glance-api-dist.conf)
- notification_driver should be messaging, messaging2, log, routing, or
  noop
- transport_url should be set

Regarding transport_url, I currently set to either 'qpid://' or
'rabbit://' but I believe you can do the full url such as
'rabbit://me:passwd@host:5672/virtual_host' which would eliminate the
need for a # of rabbit and qpid-related configurations.  We can clean
that bit up once we're sure this new configuration is in fact correct.

Change-Id: I7404a96388ea348226a21d529ea207cabfe1f366
Closes-Bug: #1307358
"}]
commit_message:
Update glance notification config on Icehouse

Red Hat bug https://bugzilla.redhat.com/show_bug.cgi?id=1087499
clarifies how we should be configuring notifications when not using the
legacy notifier_strategy configuration option.  This new configuration
isn't well documented so it was not clear from the get-go how to
proceed.  In summary:

- notifier_strategy should still be present but set to 'default' (this
  is extra important on Red Hat as they set this configuration to
  'qpid' in /usr/share/glance/glance-api-dist.conf)
- notification_driver should be messaging, messaging2, log, routing, or
  noop
- transport_url should be set

Regarding transport_url, I currently set to either 'qpid://' or
'rabbit://' but I believe you can do the full url such as
'rabbit://me:passwd@host:5672/virtual_host' which would eliminate the
need for a # of rabbit and qpid-related configurations.  We can clean
that bit up once we're sure this new configuration is in fact correct.

Change-Id: I7404a96388ea348226a21d529ea207cabfe1f366
Closes-Bug: #1307358

commit_message:
ceph::key : tests that shows how to create client.admin

Modify the client.volumes test to actually use cephx instead of
injecting a key in a non cephx cluster. It makes the second test
redundant and also demonstrates that the client.admin key can be created
by puppet instead of being automatically created by ceph-create-keys.

Change-Id: I607a0683e9f125e47aaedfa92babbe902e9028cf
Signed-off-by: Loic Dachary <loic@dachary.org>

Samples from udp publisher failed signature verifying when they
contain utf8 strs. It happened because msgpack.loads

commit_message:
Add encoding argument to deserialising udp packets in collector

Samples from udp publisher failed signature verifying when they
contain utf8 strs. It happened because msgpack.loads
unpacked data without utf8 by default and in compute signature
this strs are processed as different.
This is fixed by adding of encoding in unpacking packets from
udp

Fixes: bug #1297731

Change-Id: I3a8072eb49a61364ff1a6bff1a14ad2c9925b88e

commit_message:
Avoid redundant polling of DB for metadata

Every time self.metadata is read, it triggers a refresh from the database.
We were accessing it multiple times in a loop, which is not only wasteful
but can get very O(n^2) for a WaitCondition with a high Count.

Partial-Bug: #1306743

Change-Id: I1a82afac6c4ef56dbf87722648034c05abef4010

commit_message:
Adds command line option "daemon" to Marconi

This patch adds daemon command line option
to Marconi. This enables marconi server to run in
background and thus allows marconi to run under
devstack.

Change-Id: If7da6a17db0005848fd5ac9f745d676f8212d9b7
Closes-Bug: #1287490

If flag "SKIP_SCALING_TEST" is set to "True" in config file of integration
tests, the error occurs and trace is the following:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/ylobankov/Sahara/master1/sahara/sahara/tests/integration/tests/gating/test_vanilla_gating.py", line 383, in test_vanilla_plugin_gating

    six.reraise(self.type_, self.value, self.tb)

commit_message:
[IT] Fixed error when skipping scaling test

If flag "SKIP_SCALING_TEST" is set to "True" in config file of integration
tests, the error occurs and trace is the following:

Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "/home/ylobankov/Sahara/master1/sahara/sahara/tests/integration/tests/gating/test_vanilla_gating.py", line 383, in test_vanilla_plugin_gating
    self.print_error_log(message, e)
  File "sahara/openstack/common/excutils.py", line 68, in __exit__
    six.reraise(self.type_, self.value, self.tb)
  File "/home/ylobankov/Sahara/master1/sahara/sahara/tests/integration/tests/gating/test_vanilla_gating.py", line 375, in test_vanilla_plugin_gating
    new_cluster_info['node_info'], self.vanilla_config)
TypeError: 'NoneType' object has no attribute '__getitem__'.

This CR fixes that.

Closes-bug: #1308555

Change-Id: I84a3de535e2500dccb776c2483dcd725bb0a310c

subject: Use keystone instead of nova as example
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-04-21 04:58:44.000000000', 'files': ['doc/common/section_cli_openrc.xml'], 'message': 'Use keystone instead of nova as example

If this section is used in the Install Guide, keystone is installed
but nova not yet. Thus change the example to use keystone.

Also adjust parameter to use --os-password instead of --password and
use "service-list" as keystone command. Explain that this is not
specific to keystone or nova but to all client commands.

Change-Id: I308ba102d1217acd0a9f723643728a3e2af7f77c
Closes-Bug: #1310375
'}]
commit_message:
Use keystone instead of nova as example

If this section is used in the Install Guide, keystone is installed
but nova not yet. Thus change the example to use keystone.

Also adjust parameter to use --os-password instead of --password and
use "service-list" as keystone command. Explain that this is not
specific to keystone or nova but to all client commands.

Change-Id: I308ba102d1217acd0a9f723643728a3e2af7f77c
Closes-Bug: #1310375

commit_message:
Remove cinder-log.xml

The backlog option is not in cinder anymore, but the autoconf script
doesn't remove old files.

Also add a comment in cinder-netapp_cdot_extraspecs.xml warning that
this file is not autogenerated to avoid seeing it removed by accident.

Change-Id: I2d7fc7b47c7ce4a44ea64d371f023235de6c5b74

commit_message:
Fixed wrong exceptions use for decommission errors

1. raise Exception is a bad idea
2. SaharaException doesn't take parameters

Introduced new exception and switched both wrong raises to new exception.

Change-Id: I1d4dee8243d62d5686011eae48a15d3fda1e78f1

commit_message:
vCenter integration UI added

Added vcenter input info for vcenter into settings and changed wizard and dependencies.
Generate Cirros metadata in Nailgun.
Customize labels for Cluster settings groups.

Must be merged simultaneously with https://review.openstack.org/#/c/87397

Implements: blueprint fuel-vmware-hypervisor

commit_message:
Update config-ref with keystone_autoken options

The auth_token middleware options were not tracked yet. This patch adds
the mapping information, generates the tables and include them in the
config-reference.

This patch also moves the api_rate_limit nova option in the api section.

Closes-Bug: #1254568
Change-Id: I0e34cc8e0a56336118aa933e4018c38c9dcacf9b

Handle CommunicationError, Unauthorized and Forbidden muranoclient
exceptions using special `api.handled_exceptions` context manager. It

commit_message:
Catch muranoclient errors at Packages panel

Handle CommunicationError, Unauthorized and Forbidden muranoclient
exceptions using special `api.handled_exceptions` context manager. It
has protection sending several duplicate horizon error messages during
processing of one request. Also catch errors in AppCatalog panel.

Change-Id: I8a9c5de66f25c65e7676801564c7ee38a27778d8
Closes-Bug: #1307451

commit_message:
Improve User context

*) Default value for concurrency should be at least 30.
*) Change templates for names of users and context
*) Store tenant_id in user (it's very usefull in many cases):
role context:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/87984/4/rally/benchmark/context/role.py
quotas benchmarks:
https://review.openstack.org/#/c/87283/7/rally/benchmark/scenarios/quotas/quotas.py
(where we should setup quotas for passed user)

Change-Id: I00a97cb6ba20f6ee1636e56dc9ad35216ed30144

There would be two kind of "users" appears in the task
configuration file when we're using runner "constant".
One in "context" means the number of openstack users,

'}]
commit_message:
Name Change for "active_users" to "concurrency"

There would be two kind of "users" appears in the task
configuration file when we're using runner "constant".
One in "context" means the number of openstack users,
while the other in "runner" simulate the activities
of multiple "human users", which actually controls the
number of concurrent scenarios.

Rally user might easily be misleaded.

Change-Id: I4333885d877364fbd19279cf338b758abbb804f7

subject: Refactoring of diagnostic snapshot generation logic
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 406, 'name': 'Mike Scherbakov', 'email': 'mihgen@gmail.com', 'username': 'mihgen'}, {'_account_id': 8053, 'name': 'Nikolay Markov', 'email': 'nmarkov@mirantis.com', 'username': 'NikolayMarkov'}, {'_account_id': 8749, 'name': 'Evgeniy L', 'email': 'eli@mirantis.com', 'username': 'evgeniyl'}, {'_account_id': 8971, 'name': 'Fuel CI', 'username': 'fuel-ci', 'inactive': True, 'tags': ['SERVICE_USER']}, {'_account_id': 10959, 'name': 'Alexander Kislitsky', 'email': 'akislitsky@mirantis.com', 'username': 'akislitsky'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-04-20 12:05:29.000000000', 'files': ['shotgun/shotgun/logger.py', 'shotgun/shotgun/manager.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/task/task.py', 'shotgun/setup.py', 'shotgun/shotgun/driver.py', 'shotgun/shotgun/utils.py', 'nailgun/nailgun/test/unit/test_logs_handlers.py', 'shotgun/shotgun/cli.py', 'nailgun/setup.py'], 'message': "Refactoring of diagnostic snapshot generation logic

Nailgun:
* removed snapshot generation calls from nailgun
* removed endpoint nailgun_dump from nailgun egg

Shotgun:
* added endpoint 'shotgun'
* added command line interface, now
  it accepts --config key
* created nailgun independent logger

Depends on:
* patch in astute https://review.openstack.org/89261

commit_message:
Refactoring of diagnostic snapshot generation logic

Nailgun:
* removed snapshot generation calls from nailgun
* removed endpoint nailgun_dump from nailgun egg

Shotgun:
* added endpoint 'shotgun'
* added command line interface, now
  it accepts --config key
* created nailgun independent logger

Depends on:
* patch in astute https://review.openstack.org/89261

Closes-bug: #1310244
Change-Id: Ibcf4129efc1b21a91d0c27ea72f0a31ca9891e99

commit_message:
Create config file for diagnostic snapshot generation

* create config file on the master node
* pass path to config file as a parameter
* renamed nailgun_dump to shotgun
* fixed test and fixed wrong rspec usage
  (removed before/after hacks for mocking)

Depends on:
* patch in fuel-web for shotgun and nailgun
  https://review.openstack.org/89260

Closes-bug: #1310244
Change-Id: If70badfb90afc16541c79ac99255fc22d54aecf4

Update and cleanup the hadoop-cdh element. Depend on a more generic CDH

commit_message:
Update hadoop-cdh element

Update and cleanup the hadoop-cdh element. Depend on a more generic CDH
version, otherwise when the Cloudera repository is updated, packages
installed by the element no longer reflect the version it claims to be
installing.
Use the Oracle Java version provided by the new java element.
Remove the firstboot hack.

Change-Id: If94997d9330d2aee0c23f58051a262b516c2c8e5

revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-18 21:02:02.000000000', 'files': ['muranoapi/packages/application_package.py'], 'message': "Use io.BytesIO instead of sqlalchemy.byte_buffer

application_package uses byte_buffer to write an in-memory
zipfile. byte_buffer wasn't introduced into sqlalchemy until
v0.9 as part of the python3k compat changes. Patch changes
application_package to use io.BytesIO instead.

Alternative is to change the sqlalchemy and -migrate package
versions.

Change-Id: I59f23d2ed4e37063dca4d2a70e9f6184bd0e0aeb
Closes-Bug: 1309743
"}]
commit_message:
Use io.BytesIO instead of sqlalchemy.byte_buffer

application_package uses byte_buffer to write an in-memory
zipfile. byte_buffer wasn't introduced into sqlalchemy until
v0.9 as part of the python3k compat changes. Patch changes
application_package to use io.BytesIO instead.

Alternative is to change the sqlalchemy and -migrate package
versions.

Change-Id: I59f23d2ed4e37063dca4d2a70e9f6184bd0e0aeb
Closes-Bug: 1309743

subject: Fix missing function error in install_venv
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-16 20:01:39.000000000', 'files': ['tools/install_venv.py'], 'message': 'Fix missing function error in install_venv

The previous commit, 3362ee1337d47ab8930407c58311a811d471a7a4,
a sync with Openstack Common, removed all definitions of the
post_process() function from the Distro class and all of its
child classes in install_venv_common.py.

This fix simply removes the call to the function in
install_venv.py

The issue is similar to #1263940 in tempest:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/tempest/+bug/1263940

Change-Id: Iedd0c29789c4b2ab9be880f9bd320b39a9bdd277
Closes-Bug: #1307705
'}]
commit_message:
Fix missing function error in install_venv

The previous commit, 3362ee1337d47ab8930407c58311a811d471a7a4,
a sync with Openstack Common, removed all definitions of the
post_process() function from the Distro class and all of its
child classes in install_venv_common.py.

This fix simply removes the call to the function in
install_venv.py

The issue is similar to #1263940 in tempest:
https://bugs.launchpad.net/tempest/+bug/1263940

Change-Id: Iedd0c29789c4b2ab9be880f9bd320b39a9bdd277
Closes-Bug: #1307705

commit_message:
Tailor Topology Tab view to the new object model

Also refactor collecting topology data a bit and fix ugly-looking
links between topology nodes and too long `type` attr pop-up.

Any entity of object model which has dictionary under system key '?'
with keys 'type' and 'id' produces a single node. If entity doesn't
have an explicit name, it will be generated from that entity's key
(plus index, if it is a list's element).

Change-Id: I4b241aabdda906e256135d412200ff8868a77dff
Closes-Bug: #1304897

commit_message:
Fix link to image detail.

Link for tagged images was incorrectly pointed at
project:images_and_snapshots; should have been project:images.

Change-Id: Id943169bf284f701e34cb0f5d808f8b1979b8b7a
Closes-Bug: 1308499

commit_message:
display package name instead of id

When a package is toggled, the status message
confirming the action identifies the package
using the package id instead of the package name.

This change fixes it by using the package name
instead.

Closes-Bug: #1306523
Change-Id: I9006d2685f0c3a595386dbed4684d65eed5dc98a

Preserve keys in object's system area

Sub-keys in object's system area ('?') are no longer
deleted after deployment

Closes-Bug: #1308923

subject: Fix the parameter order of assertEqual in glanceclient test
revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-02-25 07:19:11.000000000', 'files': ['tests/test_base.py', 'tests/test_utils.py', 'tests/test_ssl.py', 'tests/test_http.py', 'tests/test_progressbar.py'], 'message': 'Fix the parameter order of assertEqual in glanceclient test

On assertEqual, the order of parameters should be (expected, observed).
But, some part of glanceclient test were written with invalid order.
This patch fixes this problem.

Change-Id: I7722fdce766ce3cc5bc9944dc72d7d0af0b09f69
Partially-bug: #1277104
'}]
commit_message:
Fix the parameter order of assertEqual in glanceclient test

On assertEqual, the order of parameters should be (expected, observed).
But, some part of glanceclient test were written with invalid order.
This patch fixes this problem.

Change-Id: I7722fdce766ce3cc5bc9944dc72d7d0af0b09f69
Partially-bug: #1277104

revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-21 07:51:19.000000000', 'files': ['autogenerate_config_docs/common.py'], 'message': 'Discover keystone_authtoken options

These options are not directly imported in the projects, but instead
used as a middleware in the paste configuration. We force and import of
the middleware to discover the options.

Change-Id: I6e8a7abca63a86db9dd215c012b10ef2d89c18df
'}]
commit_message:
Discover keystone_authtoken options

These options are not directly imported in the projects, but instead
used as a middleware in the paste configuration. We force and import of
the middleware to discover the options.

Change-Id: I6e8a7abca63a86db9dd215c012b10ef2d89c18df

commit_message:
Use --publish for openstack-doc-test

openstack-doc-test. This replaces --nocreate-index.

- Increase the level of docs around why the persistence
  objects exist and what they are used for and how an
  engine interacts with persistence objects to accomplish
  the wider goals.
- Pass backend conf as arg, not kwarg and to match with the
  other fetch/load functions allow for providing a kwargs
  which can be used for backend specific params.

Change-Id: Ia83e63196bcfcc966f68212f84f79a1e9f18e8bc
'}]
commit_message:
Add persistence docs + adjustments

- Increase the level of docs around why the persistence
  objects exist and what they are used for and how an
  engine interacts with persistence objects to accomplish
  the wider goals.
- Pass backend conf as arg, not kwarg and to match with the
  other fetch/load functions allow for providing a kwargs
  which can be used for backend specific params.

Change-Id: Ia83e63196bcfcc966f68212f84f79a1e9f18e8bc

subject: Add network-conf element
revisions:
[{'number': 4, 'created': '2014-04-11 13:15:48.000000000', 'files': ['elements/network-conf/README.md', 'elements/network-conf/os-config-applier/var/run/procps/settings/30-keepalive.conf', 'elements/network-conf/element-deps', 'elements/network-conf/install.d/10-keepalive', 'elements/network-conf/os-refresh-config/post-configure.d/20-keepalive'], 'message': 'Add network-conf element

Add network-conf element to carry out general networking
configuration changes. Initially, this element contains
logic to configure global TCP keepalive settings.

With keepalive enabled without further tuning, it will take
about 2 hours for an application to detect a dead connection.
This element allows for the keepalive settings to be tuned.
Different keepalive tunings are required, depending on the
general stability of the network.

Change-Id: Ia3371e9055cb7451f84f129be36a93b6b6c0d3a7
'}]
commit_message:
Add network-conf element

Add network-conf element to carry out general networking
configuration changes. Initially, this element contains
logic to configure global TCP keepalive settings.

With keepalive enabled without further tuning, it will take
about 2 hours for an application to detect a dead connection.
This element allows for the keepalive settings to be tuned.
Different keepalive tunings are required, depending on the
general stability of the network.

Change-Id: Ia3371e9055cb7451f84f129be36a93b6b6c0d3a7

commit_message:
Add TCP Keepalive settings to over/undercloud

Adds settings to direct the network-conf element
to configure the global keepalive settings.

The network-conf element is proposed in: https://review.openstack.org/#/c/86277/

Change-Id: Iff4a93224c58142d98371d40341dfdecccf7c729

configuration.

commit_message:
Re-enable lazy translation

This patch re-enables lazy translation to enable REST API
responses to be translated to the requested locale (I.E. setting
'Accept-Language: zh-CN'.)

Change-Id: I5b0ea7cf17fad14102196e581264f13cd3f8c834
Implements: blueprint i18n-messages

commit_message:
Adds a system load averages monitor

Uses the driver command "get_host_uptime" to get the system
load averages for the past 1, 5, 15 minutes.

Partial Implements: blueprint filter-based-uptime

subject: list_user_ids_for_project returns user multiple times
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-21 00:58:15.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/assignment/backends/sql.py', 'keystone/tests/test_backend.py'], 'message': 'list_user_ids_for_project returns user multiple times

Currently, the assignment table has one entry for each
user/project/role combination and the list_user_ids_for_project
method returns all the query that filter by project_id. So, if the
user has many roles in the project the list_user_ids_for_project
method will return the user mutiple times.

Change-Id: I980c113ea4e09e95bd78a957441c7fe2f6181139
Closes-Bug: #1308218
'}]
commit_message:
list_user_ids_for_project returns user multiple times

Currently, the assignment table has one entry for each
user/project/role combination and the list_user_ids_for_project
method returns all the query that filter by project_id. So, if the
user has many roles in the project the list_user_ids_for_project
method will return the user mutiple times.

Change-Id: I980c113ea4e09e95bd78a957441c7fe2f6181139
Closes-Bug: #1308218

commit_message:
Change 'plain' parameter style to 'body' in identity v3

Changing 'plain' parameter style to 'body', hopefully that will
indicate to readers that the parameter is in the body of the
request or response rather than in a header or the query string.

Change-Id: Ife12688d28011f4d5eb3081681acd2ed440efd8c

commit_message:
Add missing neutron tables to Config Reference

Add all neutron tables that have not been included so far to the
Configuration Reference.
I did not include table neutron-debug.xml since that looked wrong and
opened bug 1310061 for it.

Also, move neutron-ofa_agent to neutron-ml2_ofa and update
flagmappings for this.

Related-Bug: #1310061
Change-Id: I2bb89b141a5485cd6da73521cced934dba8c7be1

commit_message:
Sync latest Oslo

Sync from oslo-incubator commit 46f2b697b6aacc674bc040a8751997ed70490d1a

Major changes of the import are related to update policy module:
0da5de6b54 Allow policy.json resource vs constant check
5d1f15a778 Documenting policy.json syntax
33533b0d97 Keystone user can't perform revoke_token

Most changes are style-related topics:
* Improve Python3 compatibility
* Remove vim modelines
* Support Per-log-level logging translations

Closes-Bug: #1296337
Change-Id: I09f61b10b1b36015d248de25c5c6ed994717a565

subject: Fix KeyError in router:AddInterface error handle
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-08 16:40:32.000000000', 'files': ['openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/routers/ports/forms.py'], 'message': "Fix KeyError in router:AddInterface error handle

Under some circumstances the exception handling on adding an interface
to a router will produce a KeyError.

The exception happens in
openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/routers/ports/forms.py in
AddInterface.populate_subnet_id_choices.

In the exception handling code, a reverse() is called an argument of
request.REQUEST['router_id'] which doesn't always exist.

The fix is quite simple: try to look for it in the initial form data as
well, and if 'router_id' is in neither location, fall-back to the index
page.

Change-Id: I74eaf8cd024d2929fed3d4e00b644e5850e2d5b3
Closes-Bug: 1304533
"}]
commit_message:
Fix KeyError in router:AddInterface error handle

Under some circumstances the exception handling on adding an interface
to a router will produce a KeyError.

The exception happens in
openstack_dashboard/dashboards/project/routers/ports/forms.py in
AddInterface.populate_subnet_id_choices.

In the exception handling code, a reverse() is called an argument of
request.REQUEST['router_id'] which doesn't always exist.

The fix is quite simple: try to look for it in the initial form data as
well, and if 'router_id' is in neither location, fall-back to the index
page.

Change-Id: I74eaf8cd024d2929fed3d4e00b644e5850e2d5b3
Closes-Bug: 1304533

commit_message:
Use --publish for openstack-doc-test

This requires openstack-doc-test 0.11: We now can use --publish for
openstack-doc-test. This will not copy over the www directory anymore
and replaces --nocreate-index.

subject: WIP - Add script to replay elements in an existing image
revisions:
[{'number': 6, 'created': '2014-04-11 14:01:01.000000000', 'files': ['bin/disk-image-update', 'lib/common-functions'], 'message': 'WIP - Add script to replay elements in an existing image

$ disk-image-update IMAGE ELEMENTS...

or more specifically if we want to update the cinder element into the overcloud
we can just do:

$ disk-image-update ~/.cache/tripleo/overcloud.qcow2 cinder

And we can install packages just like disk-image-create

$ disk-image-update ~/.cache/tripleo/overcloud.qcow2 -p nmap

Note that not all elements support been replayed so your mileage will vary on
what you are trying to do. It is my intention to add support to elements that
do run into issues when used with this script.

Change-Id: I8b5d2bfc375552507b60167b67321ce313f74b52
'}]
commit_message:
WIP - Add script to replay elements in an existing image

$ disk-image-update IMAGE ELEMENTS...

or more specifically if we want to update the cinder element into the overcloud
we can just do:

$ disk-image-update ~/.cache/tripleo/overcloud.qcow2 cinder

And we can install packages just like disk-image-create

$ disk-image-update ~/.cache/tripleo/overcloud.qcow2 -p nmap

Note that not all elements support been replayed so your mileage will vary on
what you are trying to do. It is my intention to add support to elements that
do run into issues when used with this script.

Change-Id: I8b5d2bfc375552507b60167b67321ce313f74b52

subject: Only fetch flavor and image information once
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-04 20:21:35.000000000', 'files': ['novaclient/tests/v1_1/fakes.py', 'novaclient/v1_1/shell.py'], 'message': 'Only fetch flavor and image information once

Before the boot command is sent to the server, the client fetches the
flavor and instance information, but it then fetches the same information
after the boot. Reuse the information from the first fetch instead.

Change-Id: Ifbbe234fee9d6b0c8fbd3d29c2ba2161efef9204
Closes-bug: 1157346
'}]
commit_message:
Only fetch flavor and image information once

Before the boot command is sent to the server, the client fetches the
flavor and instance information, but it then fetches the same information
after the boot. Reuse the information from the first fetch instead.

Change-Id: Ifbbe234fee9d6b0c8fbd3d29c2ba2161efef9204
Closes-bug: 1157346

commit_message:
replaced deprecated sql parameters

The paramters sql/{connection,idle_timeout} are deprecated in Icehouse.
database/{connection,idle_timeout} should be used to have a working
keystone configuration.

Also renamed all sql_connection variables to database_connection.

Change-Id: Ia2a6e9576548a38037f695a05616948bd8706f6d

subject: Fixes render bug in neutron.conf.rb
revisions:
[{'number': 1, 'created': '2014-04-18 10:52:21.000000000', 'files': ['spec/server_spec.rb', 'templates/default/neutron.conf.erb'], 'message': 'Fixes render bug in neutron.conf.rb

After this https://review.openstack.org/#/c/85168/ code review
merged, the neutron services are failed to start becuase of -%>
in neutron.conf.rb template, -%> as end tag would omit a
following newline. please refer to
https://github.com/ruby/ruby/blob/trunk/lib/erb.rb

Change-Id: Ia35a51fc67c2305be6bdc975c924d421ba4f1313

commit_message:
Fixes render bug in neutron.conf.rb

After this https://review.openstack.org/#/c/85168/ code review
merged, the neutron services are failed to start becuase of -%>
in neutron.conf.rb template, -%> as end tag would omit a
following newline. please refer to
https://github.com/ruby/ruby/blob/trunk/lib/erb.rb
https://github.com/ollym/parrot/issues/9#issuecomment-12797823

Change-Id: Ia35a51fc67c2305be6bdc975c924d421ba4f1313

revisions:
[{'number': 13, 'created': '2014-04-17 17:40:53.000000000', 'files': ['spec/spec_helper.rb', 'attributes/default.rb', 'spec/server_spec.rb', 'recipes/common.rb', 'templates/default/neutron.conf.erb'], 'message': "Allow nova interactions attributes

Enable attributes for neutron interaction with nova.
This uses the new Common CLI method in change:
I2b2f1d94dbd67550ad3a352c2205a532173f6065

The default is to make a call into keystone CLI to query the service tenant
UUID and use that in the neuton.conf file. If the UUID is overridden, no
CLI call is made.  This does not pre-req any Compute recipes, just new Common
method.
Also see this bug: 1298640 for how the nova_url is handled, not obvious.
Added TODO's to look at handling this type of url situation better from Common.

Implements: blueprint neutron-icehouse-default-changes
Change-Id: I89dd47c802a544bdd998059b36884cb10f628223
"}]
commit_message:
Allow nova interactions attributes

Enable attributes for neutron interaction with nova.
This uses the new Common CLI method in change:
I2b2f1d94dbd67550ad3a352c2205a532173f6065

The default is to make a call into keystone CLI to query the service tenant
UUID and use that in the neuton.conf file. If the UUID is overridden, no
CLI call is made.  This does not pre-req any Compute recipes, just new Common
method.
Also see this bug: 1298640 for how the nova_url is handled, not obvious.
Added TODO's to look at handling this type of url situation better from Common.

Implements: blueprint neutron-icehouse-default-changes
Change-Id: I89dd47c802a544bdd998059b36884cb10f628223

commit_message:
Fix indistinct text in cinder control install

User complains that the database configuration text for cinder control
in install guide is indistinct. He/She was confused by the words 'the
following key' and there is no such key mentioned in this step. This may
be caused by we didn't update the text when we improve this step with
openstack-config command.

Change-Id: I57c901eef2fcf694a897d117bfe662534bd27e63
Closes-Bug: #1309755
backport: havana

revisions:
[{'number': 3, 'created': '2014-04-18 23:07:50.000000000', 'files': ['doc/install-guide/section_neutron-ml2-compute-node.xml', 'doc/install-guide/ch_overview.xml', 'doc/install-guide/section_neutron-ml2-controller-node.xml', 'doc/install-guide/section_launch-instance-neutron.xml', 'doc/install-guide/section_basics-networking-neutron.xml', 'doc/install-guide/section_basics-networking-nova.xml', 'doc/install-guide/ch_basics.xml', 'doc/install-guide/section_nova-compute.xml', 'doc/install-guide/ch_networking.xml', 'doc/install-guide/section_neutron-ml2-network-node.xml', 'doc/install-guide/ch_launch-instance.xml', 'doc/install-guide/section_basics-networking.xml', 'doc/install-guide/section_neutron-concepts.xml'], 'message': 'Updated networking content

I updated the networking content as follows:

1) Reordered example architectures to place the 3-node neutron
   architecture before the 2-node nova-network architecture which
   agrees with the order presented in other portions of the
   installation guide.
2) Changed network service naming to agree with conventions.
3) Permanently unlinked the Open vSwitch (OVS) plug-in sections from
   the Networking chapter. However, I will refrain from deleting
   the associated files in case we need to restore them.
4) Temporarily unlinked the Open vSwitch (OVS) portion of the Neutron
   concepts section until we can update it to reflect the Modular
   Layer 2 (ML2) plug-in.
5) Addressed other minor issues.

Change-Id: I7c285fcabaab65237477e8241f406dac28190344
Closes-Bug: #1309636
'}]
commit_message:
Updated networking content

I updated the networking content as follows:

1) Reordered example architectures to place the 3-node neutron
   architecture before the 2-node nova-network architecture which
   agrees with the order presented in other portions of the
   installation guide.
2) Changed network service naming to agree with conventions.
3) Permanently unlinked the Open vSwitch (OVS) plug-in sections from
   the Networking chapter. However, I will refrain from deleting
   the associated files in case we need to restore them.
4) Temporarily unlinked the Open vSwitch (OVS) portion of the Neutron
   concepts section until we can update it to reflect the Modular
   Layer 2 (ML2) plug-in.
5) Addressed other minor issues.

Change-Id: I7c285fcabaab65237477e8241f406dac28190344
Closes-Bug: #1309636

subject: Remove LDAP password hashing code
reviewers: [{'_account_id': 3, 'name': 'Jenkins', 'username': 'jenkins'}, {'_account_id': 4, 'name': 'Dolph Mathews', 'email': 'dolph.mathews@gmail.com', 'username': 'dolph'}, {'_account_id': 792, 'name': 'OpenStack Hudson', 'email': 'hudson@openstack.org', 'username': 'hudson-openstack'}, {'_account_id': 1916, 'name': 'Guang Yee', 'email': 'gyee@suse.com', 'username': 'guang-yee'}, {'_account_id': 2218, 'name': 'Adam Young', 'email': 'adam@younglogic.com', 'username': 'ayoung'}, {'_account_id': 2903, 'name': 'Morgan Fainberg', 'email': 'morgan.fainberg@gmail.com', 'username': 'mdrnstm'}, {'_account_id': 5575, 'name': 'Jose Castro Leon', 'email': 'jose.castro.leon@cern.ch', 'username': 'jose-castro-leon'}, {'_account_id': 5707, 'name': 'henry-nash', 'email': 'henry.nash@uk.ibm.com', 'username': 'henry-nash'}, {'_account_id': 6460, 'name': 'Brad Topol', 'email': 'btopol@us.ibm.com', 'username': 'btopol'}, {'_account_id': 6482, 'name': 'Steve Martinelli', 'email': 's.martinelli@gmail.com', 'username': 'stevemar'}, {'_account_id': 6486, 'name': 'Brant Knudson', 'email': 'blk@acm.org', 'username': 'blk-u'}, {'_account_id': 7191, 'name': 'Jamie Lennox', 'email': 'jamielennox@gmail.com', 'username': 'jamielennox'}, {'_account_id': 7725, 'name': 'David Stanek', 'email': 'dstanek@dstanek.com', 'username': 'dstanek'}, {'_account_id': 9098, 'name': 'Nathan Kinder', 'email': 'nkinder@redhat.com', 'username': 'nkinder'}]
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-04-17 17:36:47.000000000', 'files': ['keystone/tests/fakeldap.py', 'keystone/tests/test_utils.py', 'keystone/tests/test_backend_ldap.py', 'keystone/common/utils.py', 'keystone/identity/backends/ldap.py'], 'message': 'Remove LDAP password hashing code

Keystone should not be hashing passwords for LDAP users
itself.  Password hashing should be performed by the LDAP
server, as password policies may not allow pre-hashed
passwords to be set (they may enforce a scheme that is
stronger that salted SHA-1).

This removes the LDAP password hashing code.  When using
fakeldap for running unit tests, passwords will not be
hashed.  For this reason, the hashing tests are skipped
for LDAP backends.

Closes-bug: 1308793
Change-Id: Ia0998b7fd8fb5d01b86a947d18b7e79fcffd1228
'}]
commit_message:
Remove LDAP password hashing code

Keystone should not be hashing passwords for LDAP users
itself.  Password hashing should be performed by the LDAP
server, as password policies may not allow pre-hashed
passwords to be set (they may enforce a scheme that is
stronger that salted SHA-1).

This removes the LDAP password hashing code.  When using
fakeldap for running unit tests, passwords will not be
hashed.  For this reason, the hashing tests are skipped
for LDAP backends.

Closes-bug: 1308793
Change-Id: Ia0998b7fd8fb5d01b86a947d18b7e79fcffd1228

commit_message:
VMware: ensure rescue instance is deleted when instance is deleted

If the user creates a rescue instance and then proceeded to delete
the original instance then the rescue instance would still be up
and running on the backend.

This patch ensures that the rescue instance is cleaned up if
necessary.

The vmops unrescue method has a new parameter indicating if
the original VM should be powered on.

Change-Id: I3c1d0b1d003392b306094b80ea1ac99377441fbf
Closes-bug: 1269418

When creating/updating an aggregate without AZ, current XML client

commit_message:
Avoid passing empty string as AZ name

When creating/updating an aggregate without AZ, current XML client
passes empty string as AZ name. This behavior is different from the
JSON client and it blocks API validation improvement of Nova.
(id: I2c778f2237ba5bd2aa8335a0eae80f3aad3e9157)

This patch fixes the problem.

Change-Id: I0cc4e4132ff8262c4d5a71dc5ebac3678de305d6
Related-Bug: #1219693

commit_message:
Remove unnecessary call to fetch info_cache

The _heal_instance_info cache() always accesses instance['info_cache']
therefore we should always load the info_cache so we can avoid the extra
query to fetch it.

Change-Id: I3c2e005b98abf2a80276562cc05e88ba5ff199bc
Closes-bug: #1309239

commit_message:
Sync latest network_utils module from Oslo

Syncs the latest network_utils from Oslo to help simplify the fix
needed for bug #1216247. Also adds network_utils to
openstack-common.conf.

This also includes the following commits to network_utils:

897aa7c urlsplit issues with IPv6 addresses in python26
35dc1d7 py3kcompat: remove
12bcdb7 Remove vim header
4c22556 Use py3kcompat urlutils functions instead of urlparse
0bf03b7 Add network_utils.urlsplit
e456727 Remove useless logging in networks_utils
7119e29 Enable hacking H404 test.

Change-Id: I63325c9b677c2192d24e7eb73adac272bffd4e0b

Changes from v2

Signed-off-by: Seiji Aguchi <seiji.aguchi.tr@hitachi.com>

commit_message:
Hitachi Block Storage Driver v3

Changes from v2
 - Fix remaining flake8 issue, F841.
 - Mock comm_get_lun_core() to avoid executing command while
   running test_hitachi_fc.
 - Add some commands that our driver executes
   to etc/cinder/rootwrap.d/volume.filters

   Introduce Hitachi Block Storage Driver for Hitachi VSP, HUS-VM
   and HUS arrays with Fibre Channel and iSCSI.

    This will support all features required in Icehouse:
    * Volume Create/Delete
    * Volume Attach/Detach
    * Snapshot Create/Delete
    * Create Volume from Snapshot
    * Copy Image to Volume
    * Copy Volume to Image
    * Clone Volume
    * Extend Volume

Implements: blueprint hitachi-block-storage-driver

Change-Id: I61dfc2deae8a1d1c410feed907a9ecfb3e782f0f
Signed-off-by: Seiji Aguchi <seiji.aguchi.tr@hitachi.com>

commit_message:
WIP - enable elements to be replayable

The review https://review.openstack.org/#/c/80267/ adds a script to replay
elements but not all elements support this. Starting to add this support to
current elements in diskimage-builder.

The above review will need to be pulled into diskimage-builder to test this.

revisions:

Usage of 'data-progress-indicator-for' depends on 'keyup' event.
In google chrome we can change value of input with arrows
of increasing and decreasing of integer values.
It makes 'change' event only without 'keyup'.
Place with error - gigabyte quotas in volume creation dialog for cinder.

Change-Id: I1b1d93f245570d84bf8ea13df01e00632abdf32a
Closes-Bug: #1306177
"}]
commit_message:
Fixed event listener for quota

Usage of 'data-progress-indicator-for' depends on 'keyup' event.
In google chrome we can change value of input with arrows
of increasing and decreasing of integer values.
It makes 'change' event only without 'keyup'.
Place with error - gigabyte quotas in volume creation dialog for cinder.

Change-Id: I1b1d93f245570d84bf8ea13df01e00632abdf32a
Closes-Bug: #1306177

commit_message:
Make method signatures the same across methods.

Currently some of the functionality like optional response_key, return_raw or
the obj_class are very method specific. This change rectifies that by making
the functionality the same across functions.

Change-Id: I10f509b914d140024b35d4ee013c2cc1b0994bba

subject: Updated parse_requirements to align to PIP
revisions:
[{'number': 2, 'created': '2014-02-16 17:21:32.000000000', 'files': ['pbr/tests/test_setup.py', 'pbr/packaging.py'], 'message': "Updated parse_requirements to align to PIP

Existing parse_requirements was unable to support simple
URLs used to download a packaged version without an #egg
or #egg where the package name included '-' (dash).

After further evaluation, the existing function did not
properly handle inline comments, http or git entries without
the -e option prefixing.

Rewrote function to leverage pip public functions to parse
requirement files to generate the list of packages and all
associated operation + version combinations in a more
consistent manner.

Included backward compatibility associated with supported
for broken modules in PY27, and the use of defaulting
the pip default of package==version.

Updated test cases associated with BROKEN_ON_27 instead of
monkey patching the system version, simply change the expected
result based on the system version being tested against. This
should result in a better test case such that when PY26 is
no longer supported the test cases would still behave and test
as expected.

Added in 22 new test cases to validate the changes and
continue to successfully work for previous test cases.

Change-Id: I33686a3807efe11ff62f1b02a0ce370cc44f0b35
Closes-Bug: 1280478
"}]
commit_message:
Updated parse_requirements to align to PIP

Existing parse_requirements was unable to support simple
URLs used to download a packaged version without an #egg
or #egg where the package name included '-' (dash).

After further evaluation, the existing function did not
properly handle inline comments, http or git entries without
the -e option prefixing.

Rewrote function to leverage pip public functions to parse
requirement files to generate the list of packages and all
associated operation + version combinations in a more
consistent manner.

Included backward compatibility associated with supported
for broken modules in PY27, and the use of defaulting
the pip default of package==version.

Updated test cases associated with BROKEN_ON_27 instead of
monkey patching the system version, simply change the expected
result based on the system version being tested against. This
should result in a better test case such that when PY26 is
no longer supported the test cases would still behave and test
as expected.

Added in 22 new test cases to validate the changes and
continue to successfully work for previous test cases.

Change-Id: I33686a3807efe11ff62f1b02a0ce370cc44f0b35
Closes-Bug: 1280478

ComputeCapabilityFilter only take care of instance specs
but not aggregate/extra_specs in flavor.
A comment indicating this is include in the class help

Change-Id: Ic5f7f4f88d9bc3615b39d45b960891b1a7491b15
Partial-Bug: #1279719

commit_message:
Fail to createVM with extra_spec using ComputeCapabilitiesFilter

ComputeCapabilityFilter only take care of instance specs
but not aggregate/extra_specs in flavor.
A comment indicating this is include in the class help

Change-Id: Ic5f7f4f88d9bc3615b39d45b960891b1a7491b15
Partial-Bug: #1279719

commit_message:
Support for django csrf token

    Now an $http call through horizon will automatically be provided
with the csrf token needed by django.

Change-Id: I50bb7180e8f4e515365deaef24891c11cb1a84e0
Implements: blueprint horizon-angular
Co-Authored-By: miziel-r <robert.mizielski@cloudwatt.com>
